Christine GallarySenior Recipe Editor

After graduating from Le Cordon Bleu in Paris, I worked at Cook's Illustrated and CHOW's test kitchens. I've edited and tested recipes for more than 15 years, including developing recipes for the James Beard-award winning Mister Jiu's in Chinatown cookbook. My favorite taste testers are my husband, Hayden, and daughter, Sophie.

published about 4 hours ago

Taste the magic of Japanese curry mix.

Serves4 to 6

Prep10 minutes

Cook30 minutes

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

I love that curries are made all over the world with a plethora of spices, vegetables, legumes, and proteins, from a saucy coconut milk-based Thai green curry to rich Indian lamb curry. While there are times I’m motivated to dedicate the time to making a slow-cooked curry, I turn to this easy Japanese beef curry on weeknights instead. Thanks to an ingredient shortcut and a package of ground beef, this comes together in just about 30 minutes and has a complexity of flavors that is just as satisfying as something that’s been simmering all day. I usually serve this homey curry over steamed white rice, but my favorite way to eat any leftovers is over chewy udon noodles or long ramen noodles.

Why You’ll Love It

  • Only 5 ingredients. There’s no long list of spices to buy. All you need is a box of Japanese curry mix, ground beef, onion, potato, and carrot. 
  • It tastes like it’s been cooking all day. Most curries need to cook for a long time to be flavorful, but not this one. After just 30 minutes, you’ll be sitting down to a hearty, flavorful curry.

Key Ingredients in Easy Japanese Beef Curry

  • Japanese curry mix: Japanese curry mix is basically curry spices cooked into an oil-based roux. While you can make homemade Japanese curry mix, store-bought, shelf-stable curry mix can be found in well-stocked grocery stores. This recipe uses a 3.2-ounce box from S&B Golden, but you can also buy Vermont Curry’s 8.1-oz box and use 5 out of the 12 blocks.
  • Ground beef: Grab a pound of lean ground beef, which cooks and absorbs flavor quickly. I like using 85 or 90% lean because there’s enough fat that you don’t need to start cooking it in oil, but lean enough that you don’t have to drain excess fat out of the beef.
  • Vegetables: All you have to do is remember 1-1-1: one yellow onion, one medium carrot, and one large Yukon Gold potato. For a pop of color and a little sweetness, you can also throw in some frozen peas at the end.

How to Make Easy Japanese Beef Curry

  1. Cook the beef and onion. Sauté ground beef and onion together until the beef is cooked through and the onion is tender. You don’t need any oil in the pot; there’s plenty in the ground beef.
  2. Bloom the curry mix. Add the Japanese curry mix in a few pieces and stir until it melts and coats the beef and onion.
  3. Cook with the water and vegetables. Stir in water, a diced Yukon Gold potato, and sliced carrots. Cover and simmer until the vegetables are tender. If you’d like to use frozen peas, stir them in at the end and cook just until heated through.

Helpful Swaps

  • Japanese curry mix comes in various heat and spice levels; choose from mild, medium, or hot.
  • Ground turkey can be used in place of the ground beef, but heat a little vegetable oil in the pot before cooking because turkey is leaner than beef and you don’t want it to stick.

Comments

Taste the magic of Japanese curry mix.

Nutritional Info

Ingredients

  • 1 pound

    lean ground beef

  • 1

    medium yellow onion, diced (about 1 1/2 cups)

  • 1 1/4 teaspoons

    kosher salt, plus more as needed

  • 1

    (3.2-ounce) box S&B Golden Curry (Japanese curry sauce mix)

  • 2 1/3 cups

    water

  • 1

    large Yukon Gold potato (about 8 ounces), peeled if desired and diced

  • 1

    medium carrot (about 6 ounces), peeled, halved lengthwise, and thinly sliced crosswise

  • 2/3 cup

    frozen peas (do not thaw, optional)

  • Steamed white rice, for serving

  • Fukujinzuke (Japanese pickled radish), for serving (optional)

  1. Heat a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 1 pound lean ground beef and 1 diced medium yellow onion. Season with 1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt and cook, breaking up the meat with a stiff spatula into bite-sized pieces and stirring occasionally, until the beef is cooked through, the onion is softened, and most of the released liquid has evaporated, about 7 minutes.

  2. Break up 1 (3.2-ounce) box Japanese curry sauce mix into a few pieces and add to the saucepan. Stir until the curry melts and coats the beef mixture. Stir in 2 1/3 cups water, 1 large diced Yukon Gold potato, and 1 thinly sliced medium carrot. Scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the saucepan and bring to a boil.

  3. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer, stirring halfway through, until the potatoes and carrots are tender and the flavors meld, 15 to 20 minutes total.

  4. Stir in 2/3 cup frozen peas if desired and cook uncovered until heated through, about 1 minute. Taste and season with more kosher salt as needed. Serve with steamed white rice and fukujinzuke if desired.

Recipe Notes

Japanese curry mix: This recipe uses a 3.2-ounce box from S&B Golden, but you can also buy Vermont Curry’s 8.1-oz box and use 5 out of the 12 blocks.

Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
